summary: Andy Sieg: "We remain cautious in terms of where to deploy incremental risk assets" Sieg oversees a global wealth business at Citi with more than $1 trillion in client assets . Sieg noted that there have been "as many downward [earnings] revisions as we've seen in a long, long time"  S&P 500 snapped a nine-day winning streak on Monday . The Dow Jones Industrial Average also ended a nine day winning streak, its best since 2023 . All three major indexes are in the negative for the year with the Nasdaq leading with an 8.5% drop .  Citi's wealth management division posted revenue of $2.1 billion . Client investment assets were aided by $16.5 billion in net new investment assets . A slowdown on both fronts could result in a double whammy for Citi .  Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent aims to soothe nerves of international investors . Bill Ackman: Trump tariffs on China should be paused and taken down . Apollo CEO: I don't agree with Warren Buffett on tariffs .

Advanced Micro Devices Inc. is set to report results Tuesday after market close . Arm Holdings Plc will give its earnings figures postmarket on Wednesday . AMD shares slipped as much as 3.1% Tuesday, while Arm fell more than 3% before paring most of those .  Palantir Technologies Inc. boosted its 2025 revenue outlook, saying demand for its AI software was a “ravenous whirlwind” Its shares, which had soared more than 67% over the last month, slumped as much as 15% intraday Tuesday .  AMD is expected to report $7.1 billion in revenue, a 30% increase . Nvidia’s results, which come at the end of the earnings season, have outsized importance due to its place at the helm of AI hardware .  AMD said it would seek licenses to export to China, but receiving them is uncertain . The company gave a disappointing outlook for data center business, a key area of growth . Nvidia said the same limits would cost it $5.5 billion .  Nvidia is still by far the most important stock in the AI trade . It could buck a trend of weak reports from some of its chip peers .  DoorDash has offered 180 pence in cash for each Deliveroo share . Palantir Technologies Inc. dropped as much as 15% Tuesday after its results failed to live up to investors’ loftiest expectations . Microsoft Corp. expanded its deal to buy carbon removal credits from Stockholm Exergi AB .  OpenAI walked back part of its effort to create a more conventional for-profit company, but its restructuring plans still have not received the blessing of a major stakeholder . Contemporary Amperex Technology Co. Ltd. began gauging investor interest for a share sale that may fetch $5 billion .  TechTarget Inc. Meta Platforms (META) CEO Mark Zuckerberg continues to focus on keeping the company efficient, while the firm's growth outlook is strong . The tech giant is poised to increase its earnings at an annual rate of 15%-20%, according to Gilman Hill Asset Management CEO Jenny Van Leeuwen Harrington . Harrington called the name "one of the most compelling" Mag 7 stocks .  META's margin margin rose to 41% last quarter versus 38% during the same period a year earlier . In the last month, the shares have gained 16%, while in the last three months, they fell 14% . While we acknowledge the potential of META, we believe AI stocks hold greater promise for delivering higher returns .

Nuveen chief investment officer Saira Malik: "History did repeat itself" "Liberation Day" was peak tariff pain, and we've seen a lot of negotiating since then," Malik says . Malik leads a business with more than $1 trillion in assets under management .  S&P 500 snapped a nine-day winning streak on Monday, the longest winning streak for stocks dating back to 2004 . The tech-heavy Nasdaq Composite has gained 13.5% over the past month . All three major indexes are in the negative for the year, with the Nasdaq leading with an 8.5%.  Investors can get high-single-digit returns in fixed-income and high-yield corporate bonds, Malik said . "You're not going to earn that in cash," Malik said. "You can outearn cash in areas of fixed income and equities," he said .  The latest stock market news and in-depth analysis, including events that move stocks . Vijaye Raji founded Statsig, which helps software engineering teams test, analyze, and roll out new products . He and his team have inked a $100 million Series C deal at a valuation of $1.1 billion . Raji: "I like to jump off cliffs without parachutes"  Datadog confirmed its acquisition of Eppo for $220 million . Statsig and Eppo are such direct competitors that Statsig paid to promote apageon its website titled: “Don't Get Eppo | Try Statsig”  The timing and choice of which features get rolled is decided by personality as much as anything else, said Raji . Facebook would see if a tweak to the appearance of Facebook’s timeline would translate to increased engagement for a subset of users .  Statsig has attracted a stream of customers from human resources startup Rippling to productivity app Notion . Tech giant OpenAI is also a customer, according to Statsig’s website .  “AI accelerated our journey,” Raji declared . “I’m not surprised, but it’s a good thing for the company,’ he said .

Microsoft's cloud business was the clear standout this quarter . Azure revenue grew 33% year-over-year, which was the fastest among the three major cloud providers . Microsoft boasts the highest Zacks Rank of the Mag 7 group, with aZacks Rank #2 (Buy)  Microsoft's Intelligent Cloud segment reported $26.8 billion in revenue, up 21% from the prior year . By comparison, Amazon Web Services posted revenue of $29.3 billion, maintaining its lead in scale butgrowing just 17% .  As US–China trade tensions rise, tariff exposure has become a key risk factor for large-cap tech investors . Apple's reliance on Chinese manufacturing makes it especially sensitive to rising import costs and potential supply chain snarls . Amazon's global retail supply chain depends heavily on low-cost manufacturing hubs in China .  Meta Platforms is less directly exposed to supply chains but faces its own geopolitical and macro risks . The company has long been restricted in China, but it still relies on global ad spending from brands with supply chains . Microsoft benefits from a business model centered around software, cloud infrastructure, and enterprise services .  Microsoft is expected to grow its earnings 14.6% annually over the next three to five years . The rest of the group is trading well below their five-year averages . Microsoft continues to stand out as a well-rounded member of the Magnificent 7 .  Microsoft remains a compelling core holding for long-term investors seeking stability, growth, and resilience in an uncertain market . While many of its peers also look attractively valued after recent pullbacks, Microsoft remains an attractive core holding .  These returns are from hypothetical portfolios consisting of stocks with Zacks Rank = 1 that were rebalanced monthly with zero transaction costs . These are not the returns of actual portfolios of stocks . The S&P 500 is an unmanaged index .  Amazon.com, Apple, Microsoft and Meta Platforms, Inc. are among the top tech companies in the U.S. market . Today, you can download 7 Best Stocks for the Next 30 Days .

Meta Platforms (META) has been pounding the table on the table for years . The social media giant’sQ1 earnings blew the doors off expectations last week, forcing analysts to scramble and reprice the stock . Yet, the core story hasn't changed: Meta's growth is relentless, and its shares are ultra cheap .  Q1 revenue surpasses $42.3 billion, up 16% year-over-year, smashing estimates by nearly $1 billion . The company’s Family Daily Active People (DAP) climbed to 3.43 billion, a 6% jump, reflecting sticky user engagement across Facebook, Instagram, and WhatsApp .  Meta's heavy investment in AI infrastructure and models like Llama is the company’s ‘secret sauce” It would seem that the company is investing heavily in AI to optimize everything from content curation to ad delivery . CFO Susan Li noted that these tools are “unlocking new levels of efficiency and engagement,” particularly in short form video and messaging .  Reality Labs posted a 37% EPS surge in Q1, beating Wall Street's $5.25 forecast . The company posted a 35% surge in net income to $16.64 billion and 37% jump in EPS to $6.43 . The trend should only pick up from here, as AI-driven ad delivery and workforce optimization have proven notable margin boosters .  Even when we employ Wall Street’s depressed $25.47 estimate for the year, the stock trades at just 23x forward earnings . Conservatively, I peg 2025 EPS at $29-$30, supported by sustained ad momentum and margin expansion .  Meta Platforms is firing on all fronts, with its first quarter proving its growth engine is long-lasting and can adapt to changing market conditions . The stock’s 23x forward earnings is a gift for a company scaling profits at this pace, particularly with AI turbocharging its ad machine .

Meta Platforms, Inc. (NASDAQ:META) stands against other AI stocks in the news . The Trump administration may soon abandon the tiered approach to accessing advanced AI chips and replace it with a global licensing regime with government-to-government agreements .  The rule, known as the Framework for Artificial Intelligence Diffusion, was issued by the U.S. Department of Commerce in January . Companies must conform to its restrictions starting on May 15 . Other possible changes include a lower threshold for an exception to licensing .  Meta Platforms, Inc. selected AI stocks by going through news articles, stock analysis, and press releases . These stocks are popular among hedge funds . Seven Republican senators even sent a letter to Lutnick, the United States Secretary of Commerce, in mid-April to have the rule withdrawn .  Argus Research analyst Joseph Bonner maintained a “Buy” rating on the stock and set a price target of $725.00 . The company recently reported its Q1 results with revenues and earnings topping street estimates .  There is an AI stock that went up since the beginning of 2025, while popular AI stocks lost around 25% . META trades at less than 5 times its earnings .

The "Magnificent Seven" group of stocks hasn't really been known for being called cheap . This group includes some big tech high-flyers that led the market over the past few years but have gotten slammed this year . Yet, data center capital expenditures still look strong, which is great news for Nvidia .  Nvidia has been an absolute rocket ship over the past few years, but that ship has slowed in 2025 . Nvidia'sgraphics processing units (GPUs)are the best in class and have been heavily used in the AI race . Investors are worried about how a trade war might affect data center spending, which would harm Nvidia if it dropped .  At less than 25 times forward earnings, Nvidia's stock looks like a bargain here because it's still expected to put up strong growth after this year . Alphabet also echoed this sentiment, so it isn't planning on changing capital expenditure plans .  At less than 17 times forward earnings, Alphabet stock is dirt cheap . Meta Platforms doesn't have those same impending issues, so it gets a bit more of a premium . Investors can take solace in the fact that advertising revenue comes back once the economy improves .  On rare occasions, our expert team of analysts issues a“Double Down” stockrecommendation for companies that they think are about to pop . Now is the best time to buy before it’s too late .  Randi Zuckerberg is a former director of market development and spokeswoman for Facebook and sister to Meta Platforms CEO Mark Zuckerberg . Suzanne Frey, an executive at Alphabet, is a member of The Motley Fool's board of directors .

The Big Tech trade is alive and well, despite tariff woes . Earnings from the "Magnificent Seven" have outperformed the rest of the S&P 500 . That's well above the more modest 4% beat that the rest has registered so far .  The tech sector is off its highs from February, but the push for US tech supremacy appears to have bolstered the case for AI investments . Google (GOOG) and Microsoft (MSFT) reiterated their spending plans . Amazon (AMZN) highlighted that its AI business revenue continues to grow by triple digits .  Group grew by 62% this quarter compared to the same period last year . Amazon projectedlower-than-anticipated operating incomefor its second quarter . Apple warned that the company would take a $900 million hit from tariffs in the current quarter .  Metaoffered guidancethat exceeded Wall Street's expectations . As has been the case for two years now, there's a sense of inevitability with Big Tech .

Strong quarters from top communications stocks are moving the sector higher . The communications sector is a better value than low-growth sectors like consumer staples and utilities . Alphabet, Meta Platforms, and Netflix have solid business models that perform well .  Netflix is one of the best-performing components of theS&P 500-- up 28% year to date . Meta Platforms popped 4.2% on Thursday in response to its earnings report . The company continues to grow sales and earnings at a breakneck pace .  Alphabet also had a great report, with 12% sales growth year over year and a 20% jump in operating income for its best first quarter ever . Despite the strong quarter, Alphabet has underperformed many of its megacap growth peers .  Meta, Alphabet, and Netflix make up 46.4% of the fund . The Vanguard Communications ETF sports a price-to-earnings (P/E) ratio of 18.8 and a dividend yield of 1.1%. The rest of the sector is fairly value- and income-oriented .  The communications sector offers a rare blend of growth, income, and value because many of its top holdings have lower valuations than the S&P 500 . Telecom and traditional media companies play supporting roles in the sector, making it more value-focused than tech or consumer discretionary .  Communications is one of the best sectors to buy now . With an expense ratio of just 0.09% and a minimum investment of $1, the Vanguard Communications ETF has low barriers to entry and won't drown you in fees . Advanced Micro Devices is benefiting from surging demand for data center chips . New content experiences powered by AI could be a significant growth catalyst for Meta Platforms . To double your money in five years, you need to earn around a 15% compound annual returnon your money .  AMD shares have fallen 56% from their previous highs, but the company's accelerating growth over the past year suggests the stock is due for a rebound . Half of AMD's annual revenue is coming from data centers . AMD is also seeing surging demand for its EPYC central processing units (CPUs)  Analysts expect AMD's earnings to grow at an annualized rate of 28% in the coming years . AMD has been selling chips to all the top data center operators, includingAmazon,Alphabet, andMicrosoft . Investors can currently buy the stock at just 23 times 2025 earnings estimates .  Meta's investments in AI have significantly benefited the company's growth . The company reported a revenue increase of 16% year-over-year in the first quarter . This growth came during a year when the Meta AI personal assistant reached more than 700 million monthly users .  The stock might be one of the most attractive buys among the "Magnificent Seven" right now . Analysts expect earnings to grow at an annualized rate of 18% over the next several years . Meta's stock trades at a very reasonable 24 times this year's earnings estimates .  Stock Advisor’s total average return is 906% — a market-crushing outperformance compared to164% for the S&P 500 . Microsoft is one of the fastest growing companies in the world to $1,000 in 2013 .

Nvidia sells the most powerful data center chips for developing artificial intelligence (AI) models . Concerns have swirled about declining demand for these chips as President Trump's tariffs sow uncertainty . Many of Nvidia's customers still face increased costs and potential sales declines .  Meta Platforms and Microsoft are four of the biggest buyers of Nvidia's AI chips . Nvidia's H100 graphics processing unit (GPU) was the industry's dominant AI data center chip throughout 2023 and for most of 2024 . New Blackwell Ultra GB300 GPU can perform AI inference up to 50 times faster than the H100 .  Reasoning models spend more time "thinking" in the background to clear up errors before generating a response . This means they make better use of the data they already have, which reduces pre-training workloads . Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang says they need up to 100 times more computing power than traditional models .  Nvidia is an American company, but the majority of its chips are fabricated offshore byTaiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing . Trump exempted semiconductors from his "Liberation Day" tariffs on imports, as he understands the importance of keeping the U.S. at the forefront of AI technology .  Meta raised its 2025 capex forecast range to $64 billion to $72 billion (from $60 billion to$65 billion previously) Microsoft, Microsoft, and Alphabet also raised their capex forecasts . The dip in Nvidia stock has created a fantastic buying opportunity for investors too .  Nvidia generated $115.2 billion in data center revenue during its fiscal 2025 (ended Jan. 26) Huang predicts that data center spending will top $1 trillion annually by 2028 . Data center operators like Meta, Microsoft, Alphabet, and Amazon typically plan their infrastructure spending years in advance .  Nvidia stock looks like a great buy at the current price, especially for investors who are willing to stay the course until 2028 and beyond . Robert Smith: AI opportunities for many tech plays remain too good to pass up . "Right now they do," the Vista Equity Partners founder and CEO said at the Milken Institute Global Conference . Year to date, Nasdaq has slid 7%, worse than Dow Jones Industrial Average and S&P 500 . IPOs have dried up, with hyped Nvidia customer CoreWeave being the last big Tech name to debut in late March .
